OpenStack summit Schedule – Thursday – Focusing on Swift Object Storage

Oct 18, 2012 • colinmcnamara

We are in Day4 of the OpenStack Design and User summit for Fall 2012. Earlier in this week I have been bouncing between design sessions (figuring out what blueprints we want to work on next), speaking at my session, and learning in the users session.

Today my focus will be on building a swift object storage cluster (actually building it in the lab) with the swiftstack guys. Hopefully the swift specific stick time will get swift object storage more properly cemented into my brain.
 <Update – I can has Cloud Cats> 
My schedule – Thursday, October 18

9:00am

 Deploying OpenStack Swift 1

11:00am

 Deploy OpenStack like the experts with Puppet 3  Operating OpenStack Swift

1:30pm

 Support for Licensed Images  Building Applications with OpenStack Swift  Juju Charm School 1

3:20pm

 COSBench: A Benchmark Tool for Cloud Object Storage Services

4:10pm

 How swift is your Swift? 1

5:00pm

 Adding Federated Identity Management to OpenStack 1  Eve: An OpenStack Composite and Hybrid Provisioning Service

8:00pm

 Morphlabs & Media Temple “Breakfast for Dinner” Closing Party 2
